intro: Lachnaea alpina, commonly known as the alpine lachnaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to mountainous regions in Europe and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are characteristic of the carrot family. Lachnaea alpina is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in high-altitude conditions.
